definition: producing or emitting a prolonged, high-pitched sound : producing a whine
examples: … a coil of steel spins through a whining mass of machinery the size of a small two-story house.
The fresh wind across the big lake blew away the smoke of cooking fires and vanquished the mosquitoes that came out in whining droves …

definition: complaining or inclined to complain in a childish or petulant manner
examples: They [scientists] think that … joyful people outlive their bilious, whining counterparts.
Brooks plays a whining, middle-aged screenwriter …

definition: the act or an instance of producing a prolonged, high-pitched sound (such as a cry of distress or pain)
examples: … that night she heard a whining and scratching at her door, and when she opened it the lame puppy, drenched and shivering, jumped up on her with little sobbing barks.

definition: the act or activity of complaining in an annoyingly childish or petulant manner
examples: … but his public whining ("I'm sick and tired of it") didn't do him much good …
But "people have begun to come out of that—they're tired of the whining," [J. Walker] Smith says.
